column5: hey everyone  last year when jenn bought her fishing license he outdoors card had expired and she had to get a new one.  she was given a paper temporary copy but hasnt received her outdoors card yet.  we are planning on renewing licenses tomorrow and hopefully find some safe ice somewhere.  is she going to have to pay for another outdoors card when she buys her license for this year?  how does this work now?  ryan
LOL---  you want the TRUTH????????????????  it depends on who you talk to at the mnr, what time of day it is, and how loud you yell......
Sent my info in for a new licence and card 48 days ago. No licence yet so tomorrow i'm poaching.  I sent my info over the phone, used my VISA. I did get a confirmation # but no card.
Recently renewed mine, took 3 1/2 weeks to get the card in the mail.  Considering the time of year I thought that was not bad.

thanks for the replies guys  we went this morning to renew licenses, when she pulled out her temporary license, you couldnt read most of the info on it, including the card number.  it looks like a call to the service ontario people tomorrow to see what we have to do to get a new card sent out.  it'll suck if we have to  pay for another card after not receiving the one she paid for last year.  we ended up grabbing a one day resident license for her and headed off to find some ice.  we got to st williams and saw nobody out and dont know the area...didnt want to risk anything.  drove around to the old cut and same deal...turned around and went home  next weekend we'll be out, hopefully we can get some answers by then   ryan
